title.value: Impact in Software Engineering Activities After One Year of COVID-19 Restrictions for Startups and Established Companies
title.justification: The title explicitly states the content of the paper and what it aims to address.
title.quote: Impact in Software Engineering Activities After One Year of COVID-19 Restrictions for Startups and Established Companies

extractions.description: This paper investigates the impacts of COVID-19 on software development activities after one year of the pandemic restrictions, comparing the results between startups and established companies. It uses a cross-sectional survey distributed globally to analyze how various software engineering practices were affected by the pandemic.

type.justification: The paper conducts a survey study to collect and analyze data on the impact of COVID-19, which is characteristic of empirical research.
type.quote: Our approach was to design a cross-sectional survey and distribute it online among software development companies worldwide.

name.justification: The paper is fundamentally analyzing changes in software engineering activities due to COVID-19 restrictions.
name.quote: This paper aims to investigate the impacts of COVID-19 on software development activities after one year of the pandemic restrictions.

name.justification: The study examines the effects of COVID-19, which forced many to work remotely, on software engineering activities.
name.quote: The restrictions imposed by the COVID-19 pandemic required software development teams to adapt, being forced to work remotely.

name.justification: The paper specifically compares the impact of COVID-19 on startups versus established companies.
name.quote: Given the particular characteristics of these kinds of companies... changes induced by COVID-19 could have unique implications.
